page.title: 10BRADLEY BUILDERS, NEWNHAM
page.content: BRADLEY BUILDERS MAKE GLASS HOUSES, FENCING,HEN HOUSES AND DOG KENNELS, AS WELL AS GARDEN SHEDS.THE WOOD COMES FROM RUSSIA AND FINLAND, AND THE FENCING WOOD COMES FROM SCOTLAND AND WALES.IT TAKES 3 HOURS TO MAKE A SHED. MR BRADLEY AND HIS 3 WORKMEN MAKE 10 SHEDS A WEEK.THE WOOD IS ALREADY GROOVED AND THEY MAKE THE SHED SECTIONS UP ON A JIG . THEY NAIL THE WOOD TOGETHER USING A COMPRESED AIR GUN.THE OLD BITS OF WOOD ARE SOLD FOR FIREWOOD.THEY GET THEIR GLASS FROM PILKINGTONS .THEY DIP THE SECTIONS IN A TANK OF PROTRIM TO PROTECT THEM.MR BRADLEY WORKS IN AN OLD OAST HOUSE IN THE TALBOT YARD.THEY HAVE 2 CIRCULAR SAWS AND 1 PLANE.THEY SELL SOME OF THEIR SHEDS TO GARDEN CENTRES AND THEY SELL THEM ON SITE TOO.
